alert.note: Alert for Henry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 10:13AM CST until January 03 at 5:15PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam and rain run-off continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Illinois, including the following counties, Henry IL and Rock Island. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...An ice jam has resulted in some homes and other structures being impacted by high river levels along the Rock River in Rock Island county. Depending on ice behavior, any release of the ice jam could result in sudden rises of water, leading to a rapid flooding situation. Also, recent rainfall will keep river levels up at a longer duration. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1002 AM CST, The latest report from local law enforcement this morning reported ongoing high water and minor flooding across the warned area. The water levels appear to have risen 6 inches from this time Monday, and water was reported on both sides of River Road. An ice jam is occurring and along with run-off from recent rainfall, may continue to cause a flooding threat into mid week. Thus the warning has been extended through Wednesday evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Silvis and Coal Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
